resources.string: The following instructions must be done step-by-step. Some of the diagnostic test items are subjective. The results shown in this manual are for reference only. HTC has the right to determine whether the test passes or fails according to the details of the testing process.
Copyright(c) 2001-2012 HTC Corp. All rights reserved
Choose the appropriate test item then press \"run\"
Once the test is finished, press back key can go back to the self-diagnostic program
Once the test is finished, press back key to go to the next test
Press back key to go to the next test
Press back key to go to next step
"Press 'Receiver test', then move the device near your ear."
"Press 'Play', then move the device near your ear."
It passed the test if you hear high frequency sound
It passed the test if you hear the music
It passed the test if you hear sound comes out from the speaker
"Please don't set the device under soundless status before starting the Audio Test"
You can check \"Settings > Device > Audio profiles\"
"It passed the test if the backlight is 'ON'"
"It passed the test if the backlight is 'OFF'"
"Another device: Please prepare another device, Turn on the Bluetooth and choose ‘Discoverable’"
"Your device: Turning Bluetooth On and then 'tip Bluetooth' It passed the test if your device detected another device"
It passed the test if your device detected another device
Press the bar and the button on the side of the device
It passed the test if arrows disappear after pressing the buttons
Make sure the SD card has been inserted into the device

In the camera mode, take a picture, It passed the test if the picture is taken \n\n (Warning! Please turn OFF all data connection (LTE, 4G, 3G, WIFI) prior to testing. This is to prevent photos taken by the camera from uploading to user’s Dropbox.)
Once the test is finished, press back key to go to the next test
Please plug the charger into the device
"Check the battery charging status in the notification bar. It passes the test if the battery has a charging icon indicated on it."
Please press the On button for testing.
"It passed the test if the flashlight is 'ON'"
"It passed the test if the flashlight is 'OFF'"
Press the pick-up button on the headset
Ensure your headset is in good condition
Press the headset pick-up button or press back key to skip this step if your headset doesn’t have pick-up button
Please put on the headset and then press back key to next step
It passed the test if you hear the music.
It passed the test if you hear sound comes out from the headset
"Please don't set the device under soundless status before starting the Headset Test"
You can check \"Settings > Device > Audio profiles
It passed the test if the drawing shown on the screen accordingly
Please press the start button for testing.
"It passed the test if the vibration is 'Activated'"
"It passed the test if the vibration is 'Stopped'"
"Make sure the Wi-Fi Access Point is 'ON'"

"Turning Wi-Fi On and then tip Wi-Fi
It passed the test if the device connected to the Wi-Fi Access Point"
It passed the test if the device connects to the Wi-Fi network
"Please do not use or touch the device in one hour for the testing."
Charge the battery to full (Ensure the charging LED turned to green) before performing the test.
Please do not use or touch the device in one hour for the testing
" It passed the test if battery level >= 70% after one hour test (The battery must be in-warranty period)"
Press back key to the test.
Please charge battery to full before testing.
Please remove the charger for testing.
Please remove the charger for testing.
Please set the device in Airplane mode before starting the Battery Test
You can check Setting > Airplane mode
Please ensure the device is connected to the wireless network (Wi-Fi or 3G/4G)
It passed the test if your location is detected in Google map
"Enable GPS satellites (Use wireless networks option must be disable) ."
Ensure a valid SIM card has been inserted in the device
Made a phone call under the dialing mode.

The purpose of safe mode is to boot your device without any installed 3rd party applications. All original default functions still be available in safe mode, and all the changes done in safe mode will be reflected when you reboot in normal mode.
This will allow you to determine whether or not a 3rd party application has caused the symptoms you are seeing.
Press back key to understand how to enter safe mode
Step 1. Press Power button to restart the device
Step 2. When you see HTC logo animation and hear HTC chime, press and HOLD volume down key until it enter into OS mode.
Step 3. \"Safe Mode\" text will appear on the lower left of screen
Press back key can go back to the self-diagnostic program
The device will be set back to factory default,
Please make sure the important data have been backed up before performing the factory data reset
Put the device on a plane surface.
Touch the P-Sensor of the device
It passed the test if the screen brightness decreases
Place magnetic fixture in the middle of the blue square, It passed the test when display turns off.
It passed the test if the screen brightness decreases
Touch the light sensor and stay for few seconds
It passed the test if the Lux value (After) varies after touching the light sensor
Another device:\nPlease ensure the another device has NFC(Near Field Communication) function. And active the NFC function,
Your device:\nPlease turn on NFC in \"Settings > More > NFC\"
Click Android Beam, then choose On, you can select an app content to beam to another NFC-capable device
Put two devices back to back and make them touch together to test the NFC function.
It passed the test if the app content is transferred to another NFC-capable device
It passed the test if the Green LED turns \'ON\'
It passed the test if the Orange LED turns \'ON\'
It passed the test if the LED of AP key turns \'ON\' \n(Back, Home, RecentApps)
